alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Casper Mountain; Cody Foothills; Jackson Hole; Natrona County Lower Elevations; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 04 at 11:49AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, north-central, and northwest Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Localized flooding is possible from heavy rainfall rates or continuous or training storms. Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are likely with storms. Rates up to 3 inches per hour are possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
